Heading: Leaking faucet
Observation: The tap in the washbasin in the break room is dripping slowly. Does not cause water damage or slipping hazard, but consumes water.

Heading: Cable in the walkway
Observation: A temporary network cable installed by IT support ran across the office corridor, causing a tripping hazard.

Heading: Shelf overloaded
Observation: Too many boxes were visually stacked on the shelf in the dispatch room, which poses a risk of the shelf collapsing.

Heading: Replacing a burnt-out bulb
Observation: One of the many lamps in the storage corridor had burned out. The lighting in the area was still adequate, but weakened.

Heading: Chemical splash on the floor
Observation: There was a small amount of unknown liquid on the floor of the laboratory without warning markings.

Heading: Emergency exit partially blocked
Observation: A pallet full of raw materials had been left in front of the emergency exit, narrowing the passage significantly.

Heading: Worn chair upholstery
Observation: The upholstery of the seat of the office office chair is frayed. Only an aesthetic nuisance.

Heading: Inadequate use of protective clothing
Observation: An employee was moving an asthma-causing substance in a cleanroom without an appropriate respirator.

Heading: Scratch on the wall
Observation: The forklift has hit the wall and caused a deep scratch on the wall surface of the corridor. Only cosmetic damage.

Heading: Open switchboard
Observation: The door of the electrical center in the service room had been left open, leaving the live parts touchable.

Heading: The locker door does not lock
Observation: The door of one of the wardrobes in the dressing room does not lock properly. Does not pose a safety risk.

Heading: Heavy lifting without aids
Observation: An employee lifted a 25 kg sack from the floor alone without a lifting aid, a clear ergonomic risk.

Heading: Trash bin full
Observation: The paper collection container in the break room is full. It does not cause danger, but it is untidy.

Heading: Sharp edge on the machine guard
Observation: The protective cover of the tableting machine had a sharp edge, which causes a risk of cuts during maintenance work.

Heading: Eyewash bottle inspection outdated
Observation: The inspection date of the laboratory's emergency shower eyewash bottle had expired.

Heading: Dust on top of the shelf
Observation: Dust has accumulated on top of the high storage shelf. Does not pose a risk of product contamination or any other risk.

Heading: Gas cylinders stored incorrectly
Observation: The compressed air bottles stood on the wall of the warehouse without chain fastening, risk of tipping over.

Heading: Damaged forklift fork
Observation: The tip of the fork of one of the warehouse trucks was bent, which can cause unstable pallets and a risk of falling.

Heading: Warning sign faded
Observation: The warning sign indicating a wet floor was so faded that the text could no longer be clearly distinguished.

Heading: The window won't open
Observation: The mechanism of the ventilation window in the conference room is stuck. Not a safety risk, but hinders ventilation.

Heading: Missing machine guard
Observation: The mixer shaft lacked a guard, which creates a risk of getting caught when the machine is running.

Heading: Incorrectly sorted waste
Observation: Sharp laboratory material (needles) had been placed in the ordinary mixed waste.

Heading: Hand paper at the end
Observation: The hand paper dispenser in the toilet facilities was empty.

Heading: Slippery floor at the entrance
Observation: Due to the rainy weather, the floor of the main entrance was dangerously slippery, and there were not enough drying mats.

Heading: Noisy air conditioner
Observation: The office air conditioner made a loud, disturbing noise. It does not indicate a breakage, but it is a nuisance.

Heading: Crack in the floor tile
Observation: There was a crack in the concrete floor of the warehouse aisle, which, however, did not pose a tripping hazard.

Heading: The smoke alarm flashes red
Observation: A smoke alarm on the ceiling of the hallway flashed a red light, indicating a low battery or malfunction.

Heading: Computer screen too low
Observation: At the workstation, the employee's screen was too low, which caused a poor ergonomic posture.

Heading: The sewer of the water supply smells
Observation: The drain in the break room smelled bad. Most likely, it only requires cleaning.

Heading: Crane inspection late
Observation: The statutory periodic inspection of the production overhead crane was two weeks late.

Heading: Frozen emergency exit
Observation: In the winter, one of the emergency exits on the yard side had frozen shut and would not open.

Heading: Dusty ventilation valve
Observation: The ventilation valve in the office was very dusty. Affects air quality, but is not an immediate danger.

Heading: Damaged fire extinguisher
Observation: The pressure gauge of the powder extinguisher was red and the hose was broken.

Heading: Tool dropped on the floor
Observation: The maintenance man had dropped the hammer on a high service platform, from where it could have fallen down.

Heading: There is no guide sign
Observation: The route of the new premises had not yet been signposted, causing people to get lost.

Heading: Automatic door closes too quickly
Observation: The automatic door in the entrance hall closed so quickly that it caused a risk of crushing.

Heading: Hand sanitizer at the end
Observation: The hand sanitizer dispenser at the entrance to the cleanrooms was empty.

Heading: Broken pallet trolley
Observation: The pump mechanism of one of the pallet trucks did not work properly, which made lifting the load difficult and unstable.

Heading: Wall clock stopped
Observation: The wall clock in the break room had stopped. Only a nuisance, not a danger.

Heading: Icicle at risk of falling
Observation: A large icicle hung above the main door, threatening to fall into the passage.

Heading: Faulty Production Machine Sensor
Observation: The machine's safety sensor constantly gave error alarms, which led to it being overtaken by workers.

Heading: Leaking compressed air hose
Observation: The compressed air hose leaked from its connector, causing hissing and energy loss. No immediate danger.

Heading: Dim lighting between shelves
Observation: It was so dim in one of the shelves in the warehouse that it was difficult to read the product labels.

Heading: Clogged floor drain
Observation: The floor drain in the cleaning area was clogged, which caused water to accumulate on the floor and a risk of slipping.

Heading: Door pump broken
Observation: The heavy fire door was slammed shut with force because the door retarder was broken. Risk of crushing.

Heading: Expired batteries in the device
Observation: The rarely used measuring device had expired batteries. No danger, but prevents the use of the device.

Heading: Unclear markings on the chemical bottle
Observation: The label on the laboratory reagent bottle was so worn that the contents could not be ascertained.

Heading: Parking space too narrow
Observation: One of the parking spaces was painted too narrow, which made it difficult to get out of the car.

Heading: Broken keyboard
Observation: The shared office keyboard did not register all keystrokes. Ergonomic disadvantage and retardation.

Heading: Emergency shower testing neglected
Observation: The weekly emergency shower testing had not been carried out as scheduled.
